conclusion: The bus travels at a constant speed of 20 m/s and the puppy is 45 meters away.
The time interval between seeing the puppy and starting to decelerate is 0.5 seconds.
The velocity-time graph shows the bus decelerates uniformly to a stop over 4.5 seconds after braking.
The bus takes 4.5 seconds to stop after braking.
During the 4.5 seconds, the bus travels 45 meters.
Since the puppy is 45 meters away, the bus will reach the puppy before it can move.
